column4: Trying to upgrade php with aptitude - have downloaded php5_5.2.4-2ubuntu5.3_all.deb
to /usr/src but get an error when sudo aptitude install php5_5.2.4-2ubuntu5.3_all.deb
umm, just use aptitude upgrade.  You'll get the latest php in the repositories
so -  aptidude upgrade php5?
no.  Just 'aptitude upgrade' will upgrade all the packages it can.  If you just want to upgrade package X specifically, then do 'aptitude install X'
awesome - thanks :)
!apt > hunthunthunt_
Unfort did not solve my problem - latest GD library is not included in Ubuntu's PHP
is php5-gd what you want?
The version of php5-gd is out of date in Ubuntu - I need the latest
why is it out of date?
what's missing is what I mean
See - http://cumu.li/2008/5/13/recompiling-php5-with-bundled-support-for-gd-on-ubuntu
you are saying two different things.  On the one hand, you want the latest version of the library.  On the other hand you want php to use the bundled version of gd.  What do you want to do?
I def want the latest :)
ok, bet then we come back to my original question.  What exactly is missing from the version ubuntu has?
Image manipulation - filters, rotate etc
don't know enough about libgd to help you.  I don't know which libgd you need to have those things, the bundled one or not
np - thanks for yr help :)
check out bug #74647
https://bugs.edge.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/php5/+bug/74647
